results.title: A Natural question
results.creator_credit: Stan Gomm and Central Electricity Generating Board Film Unit
results.brief_description: Deals with the liaison between the sponsor and nature conservationists; showing some of the special nature trails they have set up for children in industrialised areas and describing other ways in which they are contributing towards nature conservancy. Presented by Phil Drabble with Art Direction by Richard Piper.

results.title: A Natural history of a psychotic illness in childhood
results.brief_description: Documented case from infancy onward. A chain of accidental circumstances provide a unique opportunity to obtain a visualised record of the gradual unfolding of the psychotic process in childhood. Contains material from three excellent sources, a family album of still photographs that tell the change in a series of static steps, a motion picture, filling in the gap between the stills with greater dynamic effect and a detailed and strangely objective diary kept by the mother. Research directed by James Anthony.

results.title: A Musical miniature
results.brief_description: The Emerson Mountaineers sing: “Seven years with the wrong women”; “Li’l Liza Jane”; and Johnny Long and his Orchestra present “In a shanty in old shanty town”.

results.title: A Moon mask by Freda Deising
results.creator_credit: Geoff Voyce, B T Film-Sound and North American Indian Films
results.brief_description: Freda Deising, a Haida Indian of the Eagle clan, is an outstanding artist of the North West Coast. For this film she carves a beautiful moon mask from alder and decorates the mask with abalone.

results.title: A Micmac scale basket: national Indian arts and crafts
results.creator_credit: Geoff Voyce and B T Film-Sound
results.brief_description: The Micmac Indians have been making splint baskets out of black ash for hundreds of years. Rita and Noel Michael from Shibenacadic reserve continue this ancient handicraft, creating many different styles to suit various needs. In this film they make a traditional scale basket, from rough log to the finished product.

results.title: A Matter of confidence: movement for children and parents (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Centre for Educational Services, Bristol Polytechnic
results.brief_description: Uses Veronica Sherbourne’s methods in a movement session for children and their parents. Shows how movement experiences presented in the form of play can develop confidence in young children. Demonstrates how relationships can develop between adult and child, and between child and child. Includes a sequence involving slow learning children. Devised and narrated by Veronica Sherbourne.

results.title: A Mandate to assist
results.creator_credit: Ramakantha Sarma and United Nations Films
results.brief_description: The Jengka Triangle Program located 120 miles north-east of Kuala Lumpur involves a broad spectrum of development activities - clearing of jungle areas, planting of rubber trees and oil palms, resettlement of thousands of under-employed families from overworked agricultural areas and the establishment of new communities with provision for health care and education. The project is a joint undertaking of the Malaysian Government and the World Bank, and provides a vivid example of the international community’s mandate to assist developing countries.

results.title: A Man with a problem
results.brief_description: Demonstrates psychological treatment of a chronic alcoholic patient. Conditioning with electric shock is used to develop aversion to alcohol in an experimental form of behavior therapy. Emphasises the need for cooperation of all involved with the patient and the complexity of the problem.

results.title: A Man for all seasons [a discussion]
results.creator_credit: Daryl Wayland and Country Education Project
results.brief_description: Bolt’s play, set in Tudor England in the 16th century, concentrates on the battle for Tomas More’s conscience and his loyalty. Dennis O’Hearn of Melbourne University discusses the character of More, his relationships with other characters and his historical background to the play.

results.title: A Malecite fancy basket: national Indian arts and crafts
results.creator_credit: Geoff Noyce and B T Film Sound
results.brief_description: Veronica and Jim Atwin, Malecite Indians from the Kingsclear reserve, have been making functional baskets for many years. The film shows how they select and prepare the materials and then make a beautiful fancy basket from black ash and sweetgrass.
